bibl.title: Letter from Harold W. Jones to John J. Moran, October 25, 1938

div1.p: Jones sends photostat copies of Moran's certificate as a yellow fever patient in 1901.

div1.head: Letter from Harold W. Jones to John J. Moran, October 25, 1938
div1.opener:
CGT/mfc
WAR DEPARTMENT
ARMY MEDICAL LIBRARY
7TH ST. AND INDEPENDENCE AVE. SW.
WASHINGTON
October 25, 1938.
Mr. John J. Moran,
Compania Sunoco de Cuba, S.A.,
Avenida Menocal Nos. 455-457,
Habana, Cuba.
My dear Mr. Moran:
div1.p:
In compliance with your request of October 17th for photo-
stat copies of your certificate as a yellow fever patient at the
Post Hospital, Columbia Barracks, Cuba, dated May 30, 1901, we
take pleasure in sending you herewith three copies of this paper.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, Harold W. Jones,
Colonel, Med. Corps, U.S. Army,
The Librarian. Incls.
All communications should be addressed to “The Librarian, Army Medical Library, Washington, D.C.”
